extendedInfo.description: From useful and entertaining how-tos and hacks, to delicious recipes and outrageous inventions, Instructables is the place to explore, document, and share your creations. With over 100k tutorials in technology, workshop, living, and more, we have the largest collection of do-it-yourself projects created by others just like you.

reviews.title: Crashes when trying to watch videos
reviews.comment: Everytime I click the \"Show Video\" link, it crashes. Idk if its because of my Android version or what. (HTC Thunderbolt, Android 4.0.4)
reviews.author: Nathan Nouhan

reviews.title: Just use the website
reviews.comment: Only about half the pictures ever load, and if you have to switch to another app (like if you\'re texting someone about all amazing stuff you\'ve found) you start over at the front page.
reviews.author: Loren Zeman

reviews.title: I won\'t let me upload!
reviews.comment: I made my first instructible but it won\'t let me upload it! WTF is wrong?! >:U
reviews.author: Jade Azure

reviews.title: Crashes a lot
reviews.comment: Every time I open a video link, the app crashes. Other than that, it works well
reviews.author: Erick Nelson

reviews.title: No..
reviews.comment: Links still crash a lot. The \"Recent\" Category only holds about 7 updates before showing a slew of months old Instructables. Poor.
reviews.author: Kris Arneson

reviews.title: Website is better
reviews.comment: The photos don\'t load. Also those little squares on the photos? I didn\'t even know the were captions until I went to the website. Please make captions visible on the app.
reviews.author: Qurat-ul-ain Afzal

reviews.title: No Facebook log in
reviews.comment: This app is next to useless if you have created your account via Facebook link on the web site.  When you use the app you can\'t log in at all as there is no Facebook login option.
reviews.author: Mick Beeby

reviews.title: Nice interface, fun content
reviews.comment: I\'ve been lurking instructables for months, and I\'ve enjoyed the new app. The organization and fillings are simple.
reviews.author: dawn tindall

reviews.title: Awesome idea
reviews.comment: Great idea, but the vast majority of contributions are made by children it seems
reviews.author: Mike Jenks

reviews.title: Worthless
reviews.comment: I get my instructables email updates,  but when i click on the links in them,  the splash page for the app comes up.  This wouldnt be an issue if i could actually select the option to open the app,  but it wont allow me to click through.  Happens on my bionic and my transformer,  with chrome and firefox.  If someone could write an instructable on how to fix it,  i would love to read...  On my pc.
reviews.author: travis orders

reviews.comment: Great refreshing ideas. It\'s tons of fun to go through and a place to learn a thing or two.\tI use this app to see what interesting things I come across and discovering new and innovate things inspires my creative side.
reviews.author: Joni Carling

reviews.title: Promising but broken
reviews.comment: Images don\'t load on project page. Crashes when switching between apps.
reviews.author: Jonathan Kressin

reviews.comment: Its very good but could be improved.
reviews.author: A Google User

reviews.title: Fix it please
reviews.comment: I have a galaxy s3 android pretty good phone, so I don\'t understand why it won\'t load all the pictures? I love the app but with out being able to view the pictures it makes it that much harder to make the items shown. Fix this problem and ill re-rate to a 5*star by then it will be deserved. I do love the app though..
reviews.author: Heidi Benedict

reviews.title: Good for browsing, painful for posting.
reviews.comment: Good browsing experience but not much different than using the mobile website. Editing on the go is the real reason I want this app but it is completely unusable. It lacks advanced features, like lists and linking, without doing it in html means editing on the website is still necessary. Photos rarely come in the right way up, regardless of if they were taken with the app or uploaded. Twice it has deleted pages and once an entire guide. I\'ve given up trying to use it. Forums, in particular Q&A are missing.
reviews.author: Brett Russell

reviews.title: Needs way too much work
reviews.comment: Video link shuts app down. New only shows 5 or so new ones then its the same exact ones. Easier to just go to the website.
reviews.author: dj beard

reviews.title: Arrogant cats
reviews.comment: Great app that I could browse for hours. Although disappointed to find that the \'cat ego\' button had nothing to do with felines, but was rather \'categories\' and unable to be fully displayed on my galaxy s2 screen.
reviews.author: Stephen Brown

reviews.title: App of the year so far
reviews.comment: Wow brilliantly presented. With a great user interface. The type of application that highlights just how far Android has come since the early days. And will breathe new life into any device. Fancy building the ultimate cardboard paper airplane? Or want to try cooking something new and different for dinner? Its all here. Great to browse for ideas or even find new hobbies or business plans. Essential and looks and works great on my tablet. Asus Iconia B7
reviews.author: Paul Price

reviews.title: Isn\'t really free... not for all features, anyway
reviews.comment: I downloaded and installed the app; and then created my Instructables account, on its website, after the Android app\'s page here in the Google Play Store made me believe that it was all free.  Now I see that the free version is feature crippled; and that getting the full feature list costs not merely a one-time fee, which I\'d happily pay, but, rather, a never-ending monthly subscription.  I don\'t mind paying, as the fact that I\'ve spent over $300, over time, in the Google Play Store, just for apps, clearly evidences.  But what I *DO* mind is anything less than full disclosure, up-front, about that fully using Instructables is actually going to cost not only money, but MONTHLY money... a subscription.  Ugh!  For that deception, I am hereby not going to be using Instructables; and I\'m uninstalling the app from my phone.  Pity.  It has such promise.
reviews.author: Gregg DesElms
